meanings.definition: An enzyme that breaks down the neurotransmitter acetylcholine.
meanings.sent1: Acetylcholinesterases play a crucial role in regulating nerve signals.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying the effects of acetylcholinesterases on brain function.
meanings.sent3: The acetylcholinesterases in the brain are like tiny cleaners, tidying up after nerve messages.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was as strong as the action of acetylcholinesterases breaking down acetylcholine.
meanings.sent5: The acetylcholinesterases worked tirelessly, ensuring the smooth transmission of signals in the nervous system.

meanings.definition: Enzymes that hydrolyze acetylcholine in nerve synapses.
meanings.sent1: The acetylcholinesterases at the nerve synapse help in the breakdown of acetylcholine.
meanings.sent2: Doctors are researching ways to regulate the activity of acetylcholinesterases in nerve cells.
meanings.sent3: The acetylcholinesterases at the nerve synapse were having a party, celebrating their role in signal transmission.
meanings.sent4: The acetylcholinesterases worked like tiny scissors, cutting down the excess acetylcholine in the synapse.
meanings.sent5: The importance of acetylcholinesterases in nerve function cannot be overstated.
